title: Russia Tried to Absorb Ukraine’s Kherson City. It Didn’t Work.
description: In Kherson, national songs were banned, speaking Ukrainian could lead to arrest, and students were told they were Russian. Cue the resistance.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Biden’s Asian Diplomacy
description: Xi Jinping and President Biden will meet today, ahead of the G20 summit, and after Biden’s appearance at ASEAN.

title: Turkey Says Deadly Bombing in Istanbul May Be Terrorist Attack
description: The blast killed at least six people, injured 81 others and shattered a yearslong sense of calm in Turkey as its tourism industry tries to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Here’s what we know about the attack.
description: The blast tore through a busy pedestrian thoroughfare popular with tourists. It was unclear who carried it out.

title: Russia’s War Hawks Step Up Criticism of the Military Over Kherson Withdrawal
description: Even Vladimir Putin and the Russian government were targets, but there was no evidence that the volume of blame would be a real liability.

title: Zelensky Calls the Fighting in Ukraine’s Donetsk Region ‘Hell’
description: Some military analysts said that the recapture of Kherson might enable Ukraine to shift forces as well as artillery east to Donetsk.

title: Live Updates: Blast in Central Istanbul Kills at Least 6 and Wounds Dozens
description: The attack tore through a busy pedestrian thoroughfare popular with tourists. It was unclear who carried it out.

title: Explosion Shakes Central Istanbul, Killing 4, Governor Says
description: The blast, on a pedestrian thoroughfare popular with tourists, also wounded dozens of people. Its cause was not immediately clear.

title: Biden’s Post-Election Escape Turned Victory Lap
description: President Biden trod a well-worn presidential path by going abroad on official functions just after the midterms. But the news from home kept getting better for Democrats.

title: Senate Control
description: Georgia’s runoff election could give Democrats a true majority in the chamber.

title: Israel’s Election Empowers a More Muscular Religious Zionism
description: The extreme wing of the nationalist religious community has prevailed. At the same time, religious Zionists are increasingly part of the Israeli mainstream.

title: How Droughts in Mexico Could Shape the Future of the Beer Industry
description: Brewers and other heavy water users have landed at the center of the climate fight in Mexico as the government and industry confront water shortages in the north.

title: North Korea Sees New Opportunities in ‘Neo-Cold War’
description: Kim Jong-un has launched a record number of missiles this year, hoping to leverage the tension between the United States and China, and to exploit hostilities toward Moscow.

title: 5 Books to Read About Qatar Before the World Cup
description: Qatar is the first Arab nation to host the tournament, bringing all the country’s contradictions to the fore.

title: Joko Widodo of Indonesia, Reluctant Global Statesman
description: The Indonesia president, who has kept his focus close to home, is seeking a bigger role on the global stage, albeit with a domestic agenda. His next big test: the G20 summit.

title: Zelensky Urges Vigilance as Kherson Celebrates Russian Retreat
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine promised to rebuild critical infrastructure in Kherson that he said had been destroyed by Russian troops.

title: While Abortion Rights Shrink in U.S., This Small Country Expanded Access
description: The West African nation of Benin adopted one of the continent’s most liberal laws on abortion last year after hearing testimony from gynecologists about women dying from illegal abortions.
